fields.lesson_title1: Essential Metal Guitar Tips and Tricks
fields.lesson_description1: Essential metal guitar tips and tricks for the aspiring metal guitarist. This modern metal guitar lesson focuses on the core components necessary to be a good, well-rounded player in the metal genre. This includes palm muting, djent basics, chord variety, modes and scales, recording, and shred guitar techniques.
fields.lesson_description2: The ultimate guitar practice routine (ultimate meaning best, not the terrible Ultimate Guitar website) is one that incorporates all techniques and all necessary skills into as short an amount of time as possible. If you've been wondering how to plan a guitar practice routine, or how to practice guitar in a way that gets results, look no further.
fields.lesson_title3: Master Sweep Picking In 5 Easy Steps
fields.lesson_description3: Wondering how to sweep pick faster? How to sweep more cleanly? How to just be better at it in general? You can master sweep picking with these five steps.
fields.lesson_title4: Intervals and Scales - Music Theory Basics for Guitarists
fields.lesson_description4: Intervals and Scales - Music Theory Basics for Guitarists. Intervals are the most basic music theory, and are often neglected by guitarists. This leads to a misunderstanding of scales, harmony, modes, chords and chord structure, and it would all make sense if intervals were better understood by the general public of guitar players. The major scale, natural minor scale, dorian scale and lydian scale are all covered here, but all other scales follow this same basic concept.
fields.lesson_title5: Groups of Seven - Alternate Picking Speed Lesson Hack
fields.lesson_description5: This is a very important alternate picking lesson, and is essential in learning how to shred and how to play guitar fast and build your picking speed. Of all the tips to increase picking speed, this might be most important.
fields.lesson_title6: Basic Sweep Picking - How to Sweep Pick Fast
fields.lesson_description6: This particular lesson will focus sweeping on three-strings in particular. Even if you don't go too crazy with sweeping, these basics are good enough for the likes of Alexi Laiho, and they'll be good enough for you.

fields.lesson_title1: How to Become a Better Metal Guitarist
fields.lesson_description1: I'm going to show you how to take your metal guitar playing to the next level with 7 tips on how to become a better metal guitarist.
fields.lesson_title2: 5 Thrash Metal Guitar Riffs to Practice Every Day
fields.lesson_description2: These are thrash metal guitar riffs and techniques you should practice every day to become a better rhythm guitarist.
fields.lesson_title3: 6 Ways to Write Better Metal Guitar Rhythms
fields.lesson_description3: If you're stuck in a creative rut or just want to learn how to expand your metal riff writing, this video is going be help you tremendously!
fields.lesson_title4: Sweep Tapping for Guitar Solos (2 Must-Know Patterns)
fields.lesson_description4: Learn how to add finger tapping to our sweep picking patterns. Combining these to lead guitar methods will take your guitar solos to the next level.
fields.lesson_title5: String Bending Techniques for Powerful Guitar Solos
fields.lesson_description5: If you want your guitar solos to be powerful you cannot just do the normal string bending. In this video, I'm going to show you one of the string bending techniques I use in my leads.
fields.lesson_description6: In this lead guitar lesson, you're getting 3 awesome strategies that will help you with alternate picking across multiple strings.

fields.lesson_description1: Gear Used for Heavy Metal Rhythm Workout Techniques: PRS S2 Custom 22, Hughes & Kettner Tubemeister 5, Zilla Fat Baby 1x12 Cab with Celestial Vintage 30, SeElectronics X1S
fields.lesson_title2: Black Metal Guitar Technique Lesson With Examples
fields.lesson_description2: Here's a guitar lesson on the most popular guitar techniques for playing black metal. I'm using a Vigier Excalibur Supra, a Fender Blues Deluxe amp, and a Mad Professor Stone Grey Distortion pedal.
fields.lesson_title3: Black Metal Guitar Lesson - Tremolo Picking Techniques
fields.lesson_description3: Here's a lesson on tremolo picking techniques for playing Black Metal guitar. I'm using a Yamaha Pac 611HFM, a Fender Blues Deluxe amp, and distortion is a Marshall Jackhammer.
fields.lesson_title4: How To Play Heavy Metal Guitar - Beginners Heavy Metal Guitar Lesson
fields.lesson_description4: Here I show you some of the basics of playing heavy metal guitar. I'm using a Gibson Les Paul, a Peavey Classic 50, and an Okko Dominator!
fields.lesson_title5: Whammy Bar Or Tremolo Arm Techniques & How To Use A Whammy Bar
fields.lesson_description5: Here's a quick video on whammy bar do's and don't's. I'm using an Ibanez S2075 FW guitar, a Fender Blues Deluxe amp, and for pedals, I'm using a Mad Professor Stone Grey Distortion and an MXR Carbon Copy Delay.
fields.lesson_title6: The Best Scales For Heavy Metal Soloing And Lead
fields.lesson_description6: Here's a video lesson on the best scales to use for soloing over heavy metal chord progressions and riffs. They are: Minor Scale, Harmonic Minor Scale, Major Scale, Pentatonic Minor Scale, Blues Scale, Phrygian Mode, Minor 7th Arpeggio, Major 7th Arpeggio, and Derivitive modes.

fields.lesson_title1: Black Metal Lesson - How to Create Dark, Melodic Atmospheres
fields.lesson_description1: In this lesson learn how to create dark, melodic atmospheres.
fields.lesson_description2: Take your riffs to the next level with this lesson in incorporating chromaticism into your riffs.
fields.lesson_title3: Stoner Rock Guitar Lesson - Riff Creation Ingredients
fields.lesson_description3: An introduction to slowing down your songwriting.
fields.lesson_title4: Dark Folk Guitar - Drone Shapes, Picking Patterns
fields.lesson_description4: Add some texture to your songs with acoustic guitar picking techniques.
